root: ^Amidst the carnage you notice a figure fending off a hulking demon while surrounded by several skeletons.
^Not before you tell me what is happening

c-0: ^"Isn't it obvious? These brutes are attacking me! Now will you lend an old man a hand or will you just watch me take care of this myself!
c-1: ^"Not them you fool, they are with me!"

postcombat: ^The old man hits the corpse of the reaver with his staff.
^"So noisy. I was just minding my business picking fresh corpses when this brute interrupted me. I suppose I ought to thank you for your timely intervention, stranger."

c-3: ^"Just an old man, enjoying some well deserved peace in the afterdays of his life. Well, I was. Until this whole ruckus started.
c-4: ^"First this flame-haired idiot came trouncing through my swamp. Then these barbarians started getting so loud I could barely hear myself think."

c-0: ^"Ah yes. Wandered through my swamp just days before. Didn't seem interested in conversation and almost took my head off!"
^"Then he disappeared into the mountains just south of here. Good riddance I say! Now, unless you need more Enchanting, I suggest you start looking there and stop pestering an old man about it!"

c-5: ^"Ah, my entourage. Helpful at best, nothing to concern you, [[class]]. They just tend to my swamp over yonder."
c-6: ^"Ah but I will. By the looks of it, you could be able to restore some much-needed peace around here."
^"And old Bolgar might have just the thing to help you do so. Come  talk to me when you require some Enchanting."

enchantingoptions: ^I'll have nothing to do with you

c-7: ^Imbuing an Enchantment is a powerful but expensive process that allows you to have an enchantment from your deck be active permanently.
^The Enchantment card must be in your deck and must last longer than a round to be imbued. The Enchantment will be removed from your deck in the process.
c-8: ^Leaving the Necromancer will make Imbuing enchantments impossible during this run. Are you sure you want to proceed?

c-0: ^"As you wish, 'hero'. Should you change your mind, feel free to visit ol' Bolgar. You wouldn't be the first to learn your righteousness might not overly value your life in a place like this."

bringbolgar: ^"Glad to hear it. Now be on your way. I am sure you didn't come all the way out here just to check in on an old fool."
